title: Bury Elminster Deep: The Sage of Shadowdale, Book II
reviewText: I really like this series of Elminster books, but this book felt more like a filler that took way to long. still a decent read if your a fan none the less.
description: ["ED GREENWOOD is the creator of the Forgotten Realms fantasy world setting and the author of more than 170 books that have sold millions of copies worldwide in over two dozen languages. In real life, he's a Canadian librarian who lives in the Ontario countryside with his wife, a cat, and far too many books.", '', '']

title: The Measure and the Truth (Dragonlance: Rise of Solamnia, Vol. 3) (v. 3)
reviewText: Even though the plot is rather simple, don't expect any surprises here, but theres enough action to keep you interested in reading the next book of the series.

title: Neverwinter: The Neverwinter Saga, Book II
reviewText: Much what we come to expect from RA Salvatore, only complaint is this Nerverwinter series seems forcefully drawn out with a lot of filler.
description: ["R.A. Salvatore is the New York Times best-selling author of more than forty novels, including the popular Forgotten Realms series The Legend of Drizzt. He's an avid gamer, father of three, and loyal citizen of Red Sox Nation.", '', '']

title: Charon's Claw: Neverwinter Saga, Book III
reviewText: But the story & RA Salvatore's writing style is still enjoyable non the less, A must read for any fan!
description: ["R.A. Salvatore is theNew York Timesbest-selling author of more than forty novels, including the popularForgotten Realmsseries The Legend of Drizzt. He's an avid gamer, father of three, and loyal citizen of Red Sox Nation. Residence:Massachusetts", '', '']

title: Dungeons & Dragons: Fell's Five
reviewText: Simply Fantastic! a Must for any fantasy reader fan, Very well written & the artist does a superb job bringing the action to life. only disappointment was in the end when you realize there won't be any more continued adventures of fell's five.....
